item.title: Gekisou! BAND STAR launches December 11 in Japan
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Band rhythm game from MAGES. dated.

Rhythm game Gekisou! BAND STAR will launch for Switch on December 11 in Japan for 6,380 yen, publisher MAGES> and developer Digital Works Entertainment announced.

The game will feature the following 30 songs:

  • Hit Songs by Top Artists, Band Style (25 songs)
    • “Everyday, Kachuusha” by AKB48
    • “Flying Get” by AKB48
    • “Heavy Rotation” by AKB48
    • “Aitakatta” by AKB48
    • “Koi Suru Fortune Cookie” by AKB48
    • “Bling-Bang-Bang-Born” by Creepy Nuts
    • “Otonoke” by Creepy Nuts
    • “Ikuokukonen” by Creepy Nuts
    • “RAGE OF DUST” by Spyair
    • “Some Like It Hot!!” by Spyair
    • “Watch me!” by YOASOBI
    • “Idol” by YOASOBI
    • “Kaibutsu” by YOASOBI
    • “Gunjou” by YOASOBI
    • “The Blessing” by YOASOBI
    • “Yoru ni Kakeru” by YOASOBI
    • “The Brave” by YOASOBI
    • “Blue Bird” by Ikimono-gakari
    • “Koyoi no Tsuki no Youni” by Elephant Kashimashi
    • “Fatal” by GEMN
    • “When the Weak Go Marching In” by Tatsuya Kitani
    • “Where Our Blue Is” by Tatsuya Kitani
    • “Apollo” by Porno Graffitti
    • “FREEDOM” by Takanori Nishikawa
    • “Mela!” by Ryokuoushoku Shakai
  • Classic Tunes, Band Style (five songs)
    • “Orpheus in the Underworld”
    • “Hungarian Dance No.5”
    • “Ride of the Valkyries”
    • “Light Cavalry”
    • “Turkish March”

All songs will be playable in “Solo Mode” or “Multi Mode.” In Solo Mode, you can choose from guitar, boss, keyboard, or drums, and play offline with the difficulty of your choosing. The remaining instruments will be played by the CPU, allowing you to enjoy a full band session even when playing alone. In Multi Mode, up to four players can play together either locally or online, with each player requiring a system and copy of the game when played locally.

Additionally, with “Arrange Mode,” you can create 120,000 different song arrangements with simple controls, as well as adjust the note difficulty during gameplay. “Easy Arrange” mode allows you to easily create arrangements by selecting options like genre, tempo, and difficulty, while more detailed customization allows you to change individual note patterns, tones, and effect settings.

The game also features unlockable rewards and achievements, including playable songs, and customizations for band members and the lobby screen background. There are over 200 items to unlock, including outfits, hairstyles, hats, instruments, accessories, and lobby backgrounds.

item.title: Sony Interactive Entertainment and Giant Squid trademark Sword of the Sea in Europe
item.content:encoded:
Adventure game already released for PlayStation 5 and PC.

Both Sony Interactive Entertainment and Giant Squid filed a trademark for “Sword of the Sea” in Europe on October 7. The two companies are each listed as an owner of the trademark.

Sword of the Sea is an atmospheric adventure game released for PlayStation 5 and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store on August 19. It was available via the PlayStation Plus Game Catalog at launch, but it was not published or developed by Sony Interactive Entertainment.

Giant Squid, the game’s developer, is an independent studio based in California, which raises questions about the co-ownership of the trademark.

One possible scenario is that Sony Interactive Entertainment acquired the Sword of the Sea intellectual property from Giant Squid. Another is that Sony Interactive Entertainment acquired the studio itself.

Gematsu has reached out to both Sony Interactive Entertainment and Giant Squid for comment, and will update this story with any response.
